description: A collection of circles in a thick, upside-down L-shaped formation; one edge runs along the left side of the picture perpendicular to the thicker rectangular portion of the formation. Each circle has a different number in the center denoting how many lines stem from that point. There is a gray triangle in the top left corner of the formation and a larger, darker gray triangle near the juncture of the two sides of the formation.

author.name: VertexArchive
author.description: An UNOFFICIAL archive of the New York Times' Vertex puzzle. This account is not affiliated with the NY Times. I just like the triangles.
